availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Flack (Cincinnati, black smith, QM serg. 1st KY Ind. Battery)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, blacksmith and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John F. Flack and Lucinda Flack. Blacksmith in Cincinnati in 1860. Served in the 1st Independent Kentucky Battery (U.S.A.) as private and quartermaster sergeant from April 20, 1861, to June 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 3, p. 194.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0479.
Find A Grave, "James Bell Flack (1840-1911)," Memorial #43277279, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43277279 (accessed January 22, 2021).
